intro: Neoharmsia madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has strap-like leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and its role in the local ecosystem of Madagascar.
